sentence.Network_en: By the 1930s the wristwatch had almost completely supplanted the pocket watch.
sentence.Network_cn: 到了20世纪30年代，手表几乎完全取代了怀表。

sentence.Network_en: He glanced at his wristwatch. "I suppose we'd better make a move."
sentence.Network_cn: 他看一眼手表说：“我想我们最好动身吧。”

sentence.Network_en: It was so quiet I could hear my wristwatch ticking away.
sentence.Network_cn: 周围静悄悄的,我能听到自己的手表滴答滴答地响着.

entry.def: A wristwatch is a watch with a strap which you wear round your wrist.

means.word_mean: 1. a watch that is worn strapped to the wrist

auth_sentence.content: The clock, like my wristwatch, reads nearly six-thirty-five.
auth_sentence.res_content: The clock, like my wristwatch, reads nearly six-thirty-five.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The clock, like my wristwatch, reads nearly six-thirty-five.

auth_sentence.content: It is Ireland's most contentious wristwatch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is Ireland's most contentious wristwatch.

auth_sentence.content: Day is making a broad gesture out of checking his wristwatch.
auth_sentence.res_content: Day is making a broad gesture out of checking his wristwatch.

sentences.en: a gold wristwatch in a presentation case
He has a very expensive wristwatch and he misses no opportunity to show it off.
sentences.cn: 他有一只昂贵的手表,他总是不放过任何机会来炫耀。

sentences.en: It was so quiet I could hear my wristwatch ticking away.
sentences.cn: 周围静悄悄的,我能听到自己的手表滴答滴答地响着。
